Paragraphs: Caleb stepped into the dimly lit workshop, his eyes adjusting to the glow of brass and gears.
The clockmaker, an elderly man with spectacles perched on his nose, was hunched over a massive clock.
'Every tick matters,' he said without looking up. 'And every tock must follow.'
Caleb's first task was to repair a broken timepiece, its gears scattered like puzzle pieces.
With steady hands, he began piecing it together, each gear fitting perfectly into place.
'You have the makings of a master,' the clockmaker said, a rare smile on his face.
